google_play_reviews.content: Cannot create reminders/events
Straightforward, minimal setup, and syncs with Google while simultaneously supporting offline calendars
You can't see all months together
Old Calendar And Etar - OpenSource Calendar Date A March 29, 2019

now that Google has completely ruined Google calendar, I urgently needed an app that is useable. This app has everything I wanted and it's extremely easy to use, while also being powerful enough to control notifications.

How come there's no reviews for this wonderful calendar! Has everything you need in a calendar, events notifications work flawlessly even offline, so far so great. If the app icon can show the current date, and the search icon directly placed in the main top bar, would be just perfect.
Crashes when denying it contacts, photos, files permissions. Why does the app need these permissions to function at all? Real answer : it doesn't. It's a calendar app.

Beautiful app! Does the job with efficiency and grace. Amazing widget means that I rarely need to open the app, only to add new events and check specific details. Been using this app for well over a year now and it is really helping me organise. Creating a new event is a treat with the Android analogue clock UI instead of using a keyboard (the default for many worse calendar apps).

Requires access permission to calendar storage, and storage and contacts. I do not have calendar storage installed, I do not plan to have calendar storage installed. Offline mode should not need calendar storage.
Better compared to Google Cal.
Super app that I use for years now. But it seems that widget does not get updated on new event since android 12 ?
If you want to scape from Google tracking your calendar events, this is your app!!

Pros: good for appointment & things to do reminders. Pretty easy to use. Cons: unsynced doesn't show holidays, synced works as poorly as Google/Apple (changes appointment times). Why is this app needed if it's a replica of Google or Apple? The entire reason for this was to prevent these apps from stupidly changing ALL ones appointment times when I cross a time zone (in AZ, their zones are inaccurate). McFly, my doctor appointment is STILL at 10am on the 15th no matter where I am on the planet.
Not perfect but the UI to add an event is much better than Gcal
Does not sync with my Google Calendar at A11 although it says it does. There is a Github helpsite and/but I wish you success ...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Where does it say that Etar syncronizes calendar? Etar shows the calendar only. But this is all already explained in the readme file.

google_play_reviews.content: Very good. Just can't find how to stop Google calendar from also sending me reminders. If I stop either from accessing my etasync calendar they both stop. If i enable etar, google cal also enables them.
Privacy üòç
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I don't know what your problem is. But etar has no internet permissions. All other important permissions are explained in the readme! Reading it can be helpful sometimes.

google_play_reviews.content: It's a good, simple, easy to use, calendar app. It would be better if there were more than 6 color choices for the app itself and the widget, as the existing options are limiting
add hijri plz and a widget with both hijri and gregorian date

It works fine with Open Sync (free), but recommends Davx5 (costs money unless you know how to get it outside of Google play). It could just implement a simple CalDav client internally, and I would rate it 5 stars.
Not support CalDAV, needs money to use CalDAV
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Etar is open source and completely free.

google_play_reviews.content: I found it to be very useful and functional. Only gripe is zoom in is restricted to vertical not horizontal.

Great app! Suffices all my needs. My only issue is that when i try to edit a weekly event, there's no option to edit that single instance of the weekly event, i need to change that event and all future events. I think it used to be possible to change a single event of the series, but maybe it was never possible. I hope this can be fixed in the future
Best calendar: no ads, no network traffic, and working great! Thank you for this app, using it for a few years now. Solid, reliable app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That sounds like a permission problem. Did you give Etar read, write and contact permissions ? Further help can be found in our issue tracker:  https://github.com/Etar-Group/Etar-Calendar/issues

google_play_reviews.content: Un known language ?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: If Etar does not yet speak your language, you are welcome to help with the translation. You can find all the information on our Github page.

google_play_reviews.content: The best calendar
Please, add combined view of month (half of the screen) and day (second half).
if thered be some unpaid way to sync it with calcurse on my pc or something itd be better, but still a pretty good one if you prefer foss
google_play_reviews.replyContent: If it has to be free, you can try DavX5 from the F-Droid store.

google_play_reviews.content: No widget, terrible. Also when I click on an event in the month view it just takes me to the agenda page, not the event like a normal calendar would do. So it requires two taps to get to an event, ridiculous.
One of the better calendars out there!
Easily the best widget of any OSS calendar app, and the general look and feel of the app is top-notch professional. Snappy, pretty, and features simple integration tools for any accounts!
Great calendar. Awesome product.
Love the app there is a single feature which would make this the perfect app. If the app had support for google tasks and the ability to tick off tasks.
I install, I give permission, and it crashes.
Okay, but can't find a way to delete an event.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Click on an event and then on the trash bin icon in the upper right corner

google_play_reviews.content: Bessstttt
Everything I had put in the calendar suddenly disappeared today.
Just works great!

Hello, I really loved the calendar and its functions. However I think I'm having issues with event editing‚Äî I can't change the color of the event in my local calendar, as the color prompts are not showing up. I hope this bug gets fixed.
Way better than any calendar out there.
Nice to see open source apps like this but please add a widget
Excellent calendar with the feature I needed : import from CalDAV from my self hosted nextcould Calendar. And it looks clean and easy to use
Widget is only agenda view, I need monthly. Agenda is useless to me. Cannot add events from month view. Often forced to change view when app opens to agenda view.
Why would you need a mandatory access to contacts in order to create events?
Like it but app freezes for 2 minutes+ each event change.
Supports local calenders, and vertical month scroll! Themes are so-so and events take a long time to pop in on scroll, but it's functional which is better than 99% of the others.
Thanks for the lovely and simple calendar!
exceptional app. please add 3-day view as well! üôè
No hijri option
Works, and the widget on home-screen is a handy day-date reminder.

Not fit for my use case. I was directed here by the discontinued app Offline Calendar which adds local phone contacts' birthdays and anniversaries to the main calendar. This app didn't do that for me. Uninstalling, using Birthday Adapter / Birthday into Calendar instead.
Great open source app. Have few feature suggestions 1. Material icon. 2. Icon showing the date in supported launchers.
The best by far for sync and open source.
Would be 5 stars if it had widgets. Great calendar, but I am Uninstaling because of that.
There is no effort spent nor roadmap plan on GitHub in fixing the long plagued widget issue for this app. I would consider a calendar app to be incomplete without widget support.

Excellent calendar. Very good app. Lightweight. You can see holidays, add events, and take notes on each event. Events can be added as per the hours of the day. Optionally, this calendar can be synchronised with the Google account with another app.
Awesome calendar app. I wish more apps were open source or had more privacy

I wanted an open source calendar to get away from privacy issues, but this app requires that you link and synch with a Microsoft, Google, Facebook or Lenovo account for you to even place an event in the calendar, and so what should be one of the major benefits of open source is not present in this app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You don't need a Microsoft, Google, Facebook or Lenovo  account! Please read the readme to better understand how Etar works. With the latest version it is also possible to create your own local calendar.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple and seems to work with many calendars
Great little app. I use it as alternative to the standard program for local calendars without sync.
New Event closes when trying to enter title after October 20 update.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That's odd. Please try version 1.0.19, which already appears on fdroid and hopefully soon also on Google Play.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent!!!
Can you keep updating offline calender as a standalone app please? Otherwise great app.
I can't get it to synch. It has option for me to synch.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please read the Readme to better understand how Etar works. Etar displays calendars, but does not synchronize them. Based on your calendar you need an app like DAVx5 to synchronize.

google_play_reviews.content: I thought it's an alternative to Google calendar. It's not. It requires access to Google account and saves everything there. Stupid. Haha and now they tell me that I didn't read Readme. Guys wake up its 2019! App should be intuitive!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm not sure what you're talking about, but Etar works perfectly well without a Google Account. Besides we don't save anything on google!  You don't seem to know how Etar works, nor did you read the readme file.

google_play_reviews.content: Works like a charm.
Never a problem with Etar! Main benefit? Syncs well (I use EteSync) and no internet permission. Truly a great app. (I do wish there was a way to export.)

I installed this app to escape the hideous cartoon pictures that Google calendar uses as the background to month headers. I'm generally happy with Etar but unfortunately there are instances where dates are rendered in the ridiculous US format, eg while creating a new event. Should be easy for the developer to fix.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The date format depends on the setting of your telephone language.  Use English (United Kingdom) and the date should be displayed in European format.

google_play_reviews.content: Best calendar app on Google Play. Open-source, 100% free, syncs and works exactly as expected. Updated GUI from old AOSP Android calendar.
Works great. A good partner to the CalDAV app for managing calendars.

Was good while it had a widget. Without one it's pretty barebones. One annoyance was always inability to specify custom remind time. Other than that - reasonable and appeals to those who prefer streamlined, non-catoonish UIs. Moving away as the widget was the main way i used this app.
Super nice app! Please do a Contacts app too :)

The lack of the widget is the reason I am giving only 3 stars. The App is wonderful, but the removal of the widget is something that I don't really understand... Thanks to the old widget, the integration with my launcher was very good. Third parties are really not the same. Please enable it again. It would be nice if you add "Calendar" to the app's name (e.g. "Etar Calendar"), so if I search for "Calendar", this app will be displayed (I often forget that I have to search for Etar to find it).
Wish it had more widget options. Otherwise, a good calendar!
Please return the widget. It was great, and the widget was the main feature for me: compact, resizeable and informative. Widgets from other apps are not so good.
Useless to me without the widget and I refuse to install a separate app just for that.
Good but should have custom reminder, not just 0 min to 1 week. Sometimes I have a bug, when I change the week all my event disappear. To fix that I go to another week and comeback. LG G5
too barebone, no way to set font size and no repeated reminders
Great layout and much better than google calendar. Customizable!
Ÿäÿ≠ÿ™ÿßÿ¨ ÿßŸÑŸâ ŸàÿØÿ¨ÿ™
Wonderful app! Effortless to setup and use. Does everything the Google Calendar app does, but without the annoying pictures that you can't get rid of!
Keine Werbung + Einfach gehalten + Unterst√ºtzung von Google Kalender oder fruux + Tag Monat Wochen Ansicht + Keine Farb Einstellung m√∂glich au√üer Schwarz und wei√ü - 9/10 Sternen
Simple elegant design, best free calendar app I could find.

This app is so much more user-friendly than Google's calendar. The simple design is great and it's open source! I've been checking out alternatives for Google apps and this is the best calendar I've found. I would recommend it to everyone.
Simple and clean. Works well and is a great sunrise replacement
Easily the cleanest and most functional calendar app I've used so far. Ability to simultaneously display a second date other than the Gregorian like Hijri or Hebrew would be great!
Smart looking and effective calendar app. Syncs with all my various Google calendars.

Great Application. Works with Davdroid/CalDav to connect to Owncloud/Nextcloud server. I can now disable the stock google calendar application. I like the "agenda" view and the simplicity of the application. I am a heavy user of my calendar application on my phone to stay organized. Thanks to all the developers!!!
Clear, simple, like a calendar has to be. Just one feature is missing: the icon should show the current day rather than always 30 - like on my Palm Pre :-)
I'm using this to connect to next cloud calendar with open sync. Three devices over home WiFi. Works well, I love your work.

Etar is a straightforward open source calendar. It works like the AOSP calendar with the ability to write in events and sync to other services. The additional features compared to the stock AOSP are a cleaner design and some night mode features for those who want it. Overall it's an easy to use calendar with a clean design that works like the AOSP calendar.
Thank you for the easy to use, working, open source calendar. I love the uncluttered interface.
Very nice. Thanks for the Open Source calendar! The simple widget installed easily on Nova Launcher in Android 7.1.1. I like the pinch to zoom in the calendar view.

Really like this app. So clean. Spotted an issue surrounding privacy settings. I can't set the default privacy? Default is public. I want the default to be private, as I share my calendar with people. If I forget them sometimes highly personal info is shared!

My finger on the top toolbar can very easily slide it off the top of the screen, after which there's no way to get it back short of relaunching the app by swiping it out of the Recents view... Stock Marshmallow 6.0.
Works with davdroid / owncloud wonderfully and it's free. Thanks to the developer!

An updated version of the original AOSP one, perfect! Exactly what I was looking for. The flair pictures in Google calendar are annoying and unprofessional with no way to turn it off, so I switched to this. Thank you Suhail!
I assume you built and distributed this out of the goodness of your heart. Thank you.

However, back-to-back events that are each 30 minutes in length position diagonally to each other (don't fit into single-hour boxes) if you zoom in too much. Lastly, you can't choose to NOT e-mail updates to guests. That's a big feature miss üòï But it's far cleaner to navigate with its boxy design!
This is very high quality, but I wish it could open ICS files, e.g. attached to emails.
